metadata.title: CSS Computer Science - Complete Subjective Questions Bank
metadata.description: ALL subjective questions from CSS Computer Science papers (2016-2025) with detailed solutions

questions.question: Temperature conversion program (F↔C), Computer types for individuals, OOP Student Registration System
Monthly profit function, Volatile vs Non-volatile memory, Library System OOP
Person struct with age categorization, Binary conversions, Medical Store OOP
Tree terminology, Binary Search complexity, Max-Heap and Heap-sort
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Sibling=same parent, Degree=max children, Leaf=no children, Height=root-to-leaf path, Binary=max 2 children, Full=0 or 2 children, Complete=all levels filled except last, Max at L=2^L.
**Part B:** T(n)=4+T(n/2)=4k+T(n/2^k). Base: k=log₂n. **O(log n)**
**Part C:** Build heap: [28,26,16,20,10,12,2,14,8,7]. Heap-sort: swap root with last, heapify, repeat. **Sorted: [2,7,8,10,12,14,16,20,26,28]**

questions.question: Stack and Queue ADT, Breakeven point analysis, AVL tree construction
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Stack (LIFO): Push, Pop, Peek, IsEmpty. Queue (FIFO): Enqueue, Dequeue, Front, IsEmpty.
**Part B:** n²+10 vs 2^n/4: At n=9, 91 < 128. **Breakeven: n=9**
**Part C:** Insert with rotations (LL, RR, LR, RL) to maintain balance factor ∈ {-1,0,+1}. All ops O(log n).

questions.question: C++ compilation process, Compiler vs Interpreter vs Assembler, SDLC Waterfall, SRS vs Design Document
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Source → Preprocessor → Compiler → Assembler → Linker → Executable
**Part B:** Compiler: entire program, fast execution. Interpreter: line-by-line, slower. Assembler: assembly to machine code.
**Part C:** Waterfall: Requirements→Design→Implementation→Testing→Deployment→Maintenance (sequential)
**Part D:** SRS=WHAT (requirements), Design Doc=HOW (architecture, modules)

questions.question: DFD and ER diagrams, Language properties, Regex to FA, Context-Free Grammar
questions.answer:
**Part A:** DFD: data flow (processes, stores, entities). ER: database structure (entities, attributes, relationships).
**Part B:** Alphabet, Syntax, Semantics, Pragmatics, Phonology/Lexemes
**Part C:** [A-Z]*[0-9]* → NFA with ε-moves → DFA (remove ε-transitions)
**Part D:** CFG G=(V,Σ,R,S). Example: S→(S)|SS|ε for balanced parentheses

questions.question: Mesh vs Ring topology cables, Transmission impairments, Switching methods
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Mesh: n(n-1)/2 cables. 5→7 devices needs 11 new. Ring: n cables, needs 2 new.
**Part B:** Attenuation (signal weakening), Distortion (shape change), Noise (thermal, induced, crosstalk, impulse). SNR=10log(S/N)
**Part C:** Circuit (dedicated path), Packet (independent routing), Message (store-forward)

questions.question: RAID levels, Instruction cycle, RISC vs CISC
questions.answer:
**Part A:** RAID 0=striping, 1=mirroring, 5=striping+parity, 6=double parity, 10=mirror+stripe
**Part B:** Fetch→Decode→Execute→Store. PC→MAR→Memory→MDR→IR
**Part C:** RISC: simple instructions, 1 cycle, many registers (ARM). CISC: complex, multi-cycle, fewer registers (x86)

questions.question: Banker's Algorithm, Multilevel vs Feedback Queue, Process Control Block
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Banker's: Check if request≤need, request≤available, pretend allocate, run safety algorithm.
**Part B:** Multilevel: fixed queues, no movement. Feedback: processes move between queues, aging prevents starvation.
**Part C:** PCB: PID, State, PC, Registers, Memory info, Scheduling info, I/O status, Accounting

questions.question: SQL IN/ANY/ALL operators, LIKE pattern matching, DDL vs DML
questions.answer:
**Part A:** IN: membership. ANY: at least one true. ALL: all true.
**Part B:** %=any sequence, _=one char. LIKE 'A%', LIKE '%son', LIKE '_a%'
**Part C:** DDL (CREATE, ALTER, DROP): structure, auto-commit. DML (SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE): data, can rollback

questions.question: ACID properties, Functional dependencies, Database triggers
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Atomicity (all or nothing), Consistency (valid states), Isolation (concurrent transactions independent), Durability (committed=permanent)
**Part B:** Functional: A→B. Full: depends on entire key. Transitive: A→B→C
**Part C:** Triggers: BEFORE/AFTER, INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE, FOR EACH ROW/STATEMENT

questions.question: Network topologies, OSI layers, IPv4 vs IPv6
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Bus (simple, single failure point), Star (hub-centric), Ring (equal access), Mesh (redundant), Tree (hierarchical)
**Part B:** 7 layers: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
**Part C:** IPv4: 32-bit, 4.3B addresses. IPv6: 128-bit, built-in IPSec, no NAT needed

questions.question: Memory hierarchy and caching, Virtual memory, Process states
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Registers→L1→L2→L3→RAM→SSD→HDD. Temporal & spatial locality.
**Part B:** Virtual→Physical via MMU, Page table, Page fault triggers disk load.
**Part C:** States: New→Ready→Running→Waiting→Terminated. Transitions: dispatch, interrupt, I/O wait/complete

questions.question: Cybercrime prevention with privacy, Harvard vs Von-Neumann, Virtual memory management
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Encryption (E2EE, TLS), Authentication (MFA, zero-trust), Network security (IDS/IPS, VPN), Privacy tech (differential privacy)
**Part B:** Von-Neumann: single memory/bus, bottleneck. Harvard: separate instruction/data, parallel access.
**Part C:** MMU translates addresses, Paging (4KB), Page replacement (LRU, FIFO), Demand paging

questions.question: Language levels and conversion, Quadratic solver, Supermarket checkout
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Machine (binary), Assembly (mnemonics→Assembler), High-level (Compiler/Interpreter)
**Part B:**
```cpp
void solve(float a,b,c) {
    float d = b*b-4*a*c;
    if(d>0) // two roots
    else if(d==0) // one root
    else // complex
}
```
**Part C:** Product array, loop for input, search database, calculate total

questions.question: Evolutionary vs Incremental models, Validation vs Verification, Requirements Engineering
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Evolutionary: refine prototypes. Incremental: deliver in pieces. RAD: rapid prototypes. JAD: stakeholder workshops. Agile: iterative, flexible.
**Part B:** Verification: building it RIGHT. Validation: building RIGHT thing. Empirical: testing, reviews, metrics.
**Part C:** RE importance: foundation, cost reduction, alignment. Sign-off: review, validate, formal approval, change control.

questions.question: Red-Black trees, Hashing process, Bubble Sort passes
questions.answer:
**Part A:** RB properties: red/black nodes, root black, red→black children, equal black paths. BST unsuitable for sorted input (linked list O(n)). RB maintains O(log n).
**Part B:** Hash function h(k)=k mod m. Collision handling: Chaining (linked lists), Open addressing (probing).
**Part C:** [3,8,2,6,1,10] → Pass1:[3,2,6,1,8,10] → Pass2:[2,3,1,6,8,10] → Pass3:[2,1,3,6,8,10] → Pass4:[1,2,3,6,8,10]

questions.question: Dijkstra's algorithm, Graph representations, DFS vs BFS
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Dijkstra: Initialize distances (source=0, others=∞), pick min unvisited, update neighbors, mark visited. O(V²) or O(E log V) with heap.
**Part B:** Matrix: O(V²) space, O(1) lookup. List: O(V+E) space, O(degree) lookup. Matrix for dense, List for sparse.
**Part C:** DFS: Stack, deep first, O(bm) memory. BFS: Queue, wide first, O(b^d) memory, optimal for unweighted.

questions.question: Software testing levels, White-box vs Black-box, Maintenance types
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Unit (modules), Integration (interactions), System (complete), Acceptance (user validation). Types: Functional, Performance, Security, Regression.
**Part B:** White-box: code structure, coverage. Black-box: requirements, equivalence partitioning.
**Part C:** Corrective (20%): bugs. Adaptive (25%): environment. Perfective (50%): enhancements. Preventive (5%): refactoring.

questions.question: UML diagrams, Design patterns, Software architecture patterns
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Structural: Class, Object, Component. Behavioral: Use Case, Sequence, Activity, State.
**Part B:** Singleton: one instance, global access. Factory: create objects without specifying class.
**Part C:** Layered, Client-Server, Microservices, MVC, Event-Driven, Pipe-Filter

questions.question: Direct vs Random access storage, Performance beyond clock speed, Interrupt handling
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Direct: access by address (HDD). Random: equal access time (RAM, SSD).
**Part B:** Parallelism (multi-core, pipelining, SIMD). Caching (L1/L2/L3, branch prediction, prefetching).
**Part C:** Interrupt→Save context→Run ISR→Restore context→Resume

questions.question: HTTP/SIP and TCP/UDP protocols, Transmission time calculation, Subnet calculation
questions.answer:
**Part A:** HTTP: web (port 80). SIP: VoIP. TCP: reliable, connection-oriented. UDP: fast, connectionless.
**Part B:** 1MB=8Mb, 200Kbps → 8,000,000/200,000 = **40 seconds**
**Part C:** 10.5.118.3/20 → Network: 10.5.112.0, Broadcast: 10.5.127.255, Range: 10.5.112.1-10.5.127.254 (4094 hosts)

questions.question: Optimal vs LRU page replacement, Deadlock conditions and prevention, Round-Robin scheduling
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Optimal: replace farthest future use (theoretical). LRU: replace longest unused (practical approximation).
**Part B:** Conditions: Mutual Exclusion, Hold&Wait, No Preemption, Circular Wait. Prevent Hold&Wait: request all at once. Prevent Circular Wait: order resources.
**Part C:** TQ=4, P1(24),P2(7),P3(10) → Avg Wait=16, Avg TAT=29.67

questions.question: Relational algebra operations, SQL views, ER diagram components
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Selection (σ), Projection (π), Union (∪), Difference (−), Cartesian (×), Join (⋈)
**Part B:** CREATE VIEW name AS SELECT... Advantages: security, simplicity, abstraction.
**Part C:** Entity (rectangle), Attribute (oval), Relationship (diamond), Cardinality (1:1, 1:N, M:N)

questions.question: Normalization 1NF/2NF/3NF, Data/Database/DBMS definitions, Centralized vs Distributed DB
questions.answer:
**Part A:** 1NF: atomic values. 2NF: no partial dependencies. 3NF: no transitive dependencies.
**Part B:** Data: raw facts. Database: organized collection. DBMS: software to manage databases.
**Part C:** Centralized: single location, simpler. Distributed: multiple sites, fault tolerant, complex.

questions.question: Symmetric vs Asymmetric encryption, Digital signatures, Network security threats
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Symmetric: same key, fast (AES). Asymmetric: public/private keys, slower (RSA). Hybrid: asymmetric for key exchange, symmetric for data.
**Part B:** Hash message, encrypt hash with private key = signature. Verify with public key. Certificates bind identity to public key (CA issued).
**Part C:** Malware→antivirus, Phishing→MFA, MITM→HTTPS, DDoS→rate limiting, SQL injection→parameterized queries

questions.question: Cloud service models, Virtualization and hypervisors, Big Data and Hadoop
questions.answer:
**Part A:** IaaS: VMs, storage (AWS EC2). PaaS: development platform (Heroku). SaaS: ready applications (Gmail).
**Part B:** Type 1: bare metal, better performance. Type 2: hosted on OS. Benefits: consolidation, isolation, easy backup.
**Part C:** 5 V's: Volume, Velocity, Variety, Veracity, Value. Hadoop: HDFS (storage), MapReduce (processing), YARN (resources).

questions.question: TCP/IP layers, Digital evidence preservation, OS kernel responsibilities, Coding practices, Frequency-power relation, 2's complement MSB
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Application, Transport, Internet, Network Access
**Part B:** Document scene, secure devices, chain of custody, forensic images, hash verification
**Part C:** Process, Memory, Device, File management, System calls, Security
**Part D:** Meaningful names, consistent formatting, comments, DRY principle
**Part E:** P∝f×V². More switching = more power.
**Part F:** TRUE. MSB=1 → negative in 2's complement.

questions.question: OOP principles with examples, Process vs Thread, Types of operating systems
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Encapsulation (data hiding), Inheritance (reuse), Polymorphism (one interface, many forms), Abstraction (hide complexity).
**Part B:** Process: own memory, heavy, IPC needed. Thread: shared memory, lightweight, direct communication.
**Part C:** Batch, Time-sharing, Real-time (RTOS), Distributed, Network, Mobile, Embedded

questions.question: SQL aggregates, SQL joins, Database indexing
questions.answer:
**Part A:** COUNT, SUM, AVG, MAX, MIN. GROUP BY + HAVING for groups.
**Part B:** INNER (matching), LEFT (all left), RIGHT (all right), FULL (all both), CROSS (product)
**Part C:** B-Tree (default), Hash (equality), Clustered (reorders data), Non-clustered (pointers), Composite (multiple columns)

questions.question: Dangling pointer, Text editor data structure, Random BST shapes, Queue O(1) access
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Pointer to freed memory. Prevention: set to nullptr after delete, use smart pointers.
**Part B:** Gap Buffer (insert at cursor O(1)), Rope (tree of strings), Piece Table (original + additions). Array would be O(n) per insert.
**Part C:** Balanced (random order ~O(log n)), Skewed (sorted = linked list O(n)). Use self-balancing (AVL, RB) for guarantee.
**Part D:** Maintain front AND rear pointers. Both access O(1).

questions.question: AVL balance definition, Heuristic search algorithms, Graph vs Tree, Genetic algorithm problems
questions.answer:
**Part A:** AVL: |height(left)-height(right)| ≤ 1 for all nodes. Balance factor ∈ {-1,0,+1}.
**Part B:** Heuristic: domain knowledge guides search. A*: f(n)=g(n)+h(n). Greedy, Hill Climbing, Beam Search.
**Part C:** Tree: no cycles, unique path, n-1 edges. Graph: may have cycles, multiple paths.
**Part D:** TSP, scheduling, design, neural network evolution. Use when: large search space, no gradient, multiple solutions.

questions.question: Compiler phases, Regex and FA relationship, CFG and parsing
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Lexical Analysis → Syntax Analysis → Semantic Analysis → IR Generation → Optimization → Code Generation
**Part B:** Equivalent power (regular languages). Regex→NFA (Thompson's), NFA→DFA (subset construction), DFA→Regex (state elimination).
**Part C:** CFG G=(V,Σ,R,S). Top-down: recursive descent, LL(k). Bottom-up: LR parsers. Handle ambiguity with precedence.

questions.question: Software quality assurance, Software metrics, Agile vs Waterfall
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Reviews, Testing, Standards, Static Analysis, Metrics, Documentation. SQA=prevention, Testing=detection.
**Part B:** Size (LOC, FP), Complexity (Cyclomatic), Quality (defect density), Process (velocity). For assessment, tracking, risk.
**Part C:** Waterfall: sequential, fixed requirements, documentation. Agile: iterative, evolving requirements, working software.

questions.question: CPU components and registers, Pipelining and hazards, Interrupts handling
questions.answer:
**Part A:** ALU (arithmetic/logic), CU (control), Registers (PC, IR, MAR, MDR, ACC, SP, Flags), Buses, Cache
**Part B:** 5-stage: IF→ID→EX→MEM→WB. Hazards: Structural (resource conflict), Data (RAW), Control (branch). Solutions: forwarding, stalling, prediction.
**Part C:** Types: Hardware, Software, Exception. Handling: save context, ISR, restore, return.

questions.question: Network security protocols, Firewalls and IDS, TCP/IP troubleshooting
questions.answer:
**Part A:** SSL/TLS (encryption), IPSec (VPN), HTTPS, SSH, Kerberos (authentication)
**Part B:** Firewall: packet filtering, stateful inspection, application-level. IDS: signature-based, anomaly-based. IPS: active prevention.
**Part C:** ping (connectivity), traceroute (path), netstat (connections), nslookup (DNS), tcpdump (packets)

questions.question: File allocation methods, Disk scheduling algorithms, Memory management techniques
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Contiguous (simple, fragmentation), Linked (no fragmentation, slow random), Indexed (fast access, index overhead)
**Part B:** FCFS, SSTF (shortest seek), SCAN (elevator), C-SCAN (circular), LOOK
**Part C:** Paging (fixed frames), Segmentation (variable sizes), Paged Segmentation (combined)

questions.question: Database concurrency control, Transaction isolation levels, Deadlock in databases
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Locks (shared/exclusive), 2PL (two-phase locking), Timestamp ordering, MVCC
**Part B:** Read Uncommitted, Read Committed, Repeatable Read, Serializable. Trade-off: isolation vs concurrency.
**Part C:** Detection: wait-for graph cycles. Prevention: timeout, wound-wait, wait-die. Recovery: rollback victim.

questions.question: NoSQL databases types, CAP theorem, Data warehousing concepts
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Document (MongoDB), Key-Value (Redis), Column (Cassandra), Graph (Neo4j). Use: big data, flexible schema.
**Part B:** Consistency, Availability, Partition tolerance - can only have 2/3. CP: MongoDB. AP: Cassandra. CA: traditional RDBMS.
**Part C:** ETL (Extract, Transform, Load), OLAP vs OLTP, Star/Snowflake schema, Data marts

questions.question: Software development methodologies, Agile practices (Scrum, XP), DevOps principles
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Waterfall, V-Model, Spiral, RAD, Agile. Choose based on requirements stability, project size, risk.
**Part B:** Scrum: sprints, daily standup, product backlog, retrospective. XP: pair programming, TDD, continuous integration.
**Part C:** DevOps: CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code, monitoring, collaboration. Tools: Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes.

questions.question: AI and Machine Learning basics, Neural networks, Applications of AI
questions.answer:
**Part A:** AI: machines exhibit intelligence. ML: learn from data. Types: Supervised, Unsupervised, Reinforcement.
**Part B:** Perceptron, MLP, Backpropagation, Activation functions (ReLU, Sigmoid), Deep Learning (CNN, RNN).
**Part C:** NLP, Computer Vision, Robotics, Game playing, Healthcare, Autonomous vehicles

questions.question: Programming paradigms comparison, Exception handling, Modern programming features
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Procedural (step-by-step), OOP (objects), Functional (pure functions, immutability), Logic (declarative).
**Part B:** try-catch-finally, throw, custom exceptions, exception hierarchy, best practices (specific catches, cleanup in finally).
**Part C:** Lambda expressions, generics, annotations, streams, async/await, pattern matching

questions.question: Data structures for specific problems, Algorithm complexity analysis, Recursion vs Iteration
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Array (random access), Linked List (insertions), Hash Table (lookup), Tree (hierarchical), Graph (relationships).
**Part B:** Time: O(1), O(log n), O(n), O(n log n), O(n²), O(2^n). Space complexity. Best/Average/Worst case.
**Part C:** Recursion: elegant, memory overhead (stack). Iteration: efficient, sometimes complex. Tail recursion optimization.

questions.question: Software design principles, Code refactoring techniques, Design documentation
questions.answer:
**Part A:** SOLID: Single Responsibility, Open-Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, Dependency Inversion.
**Part B:** Extract method, rename, move method, replace conditional with polymorphism, introduce parameter object.
**Part C:** Architecture diagrams, class diagrams, sequence diagrams, API documentation, README files

questions.question: Sorting algorithm comparison, Divide and conquer algorithms, Dynamic programming basics
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Bubble O(n²), Selection O(n²), Insertion O(n²), Merge O(n log n) stable, Quick O(n log n) avg, Heap O(n log n).
**Part B:** Divide into subproblems, solve recursively, combine. Examples: Merge Sort, Quick Sort, Binary Search.
**Part C:** Overlapping subproblems, optimal substructure. Memoization (top-down), Tabulation (bottom-up). Examples: Fibonacci, Knapsack, LCS.

questions.question: Graph algorithms applications, Shortest path algorithms, Minimum spanning tree
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Social networks, maps/navigation, network routing, dependency resolution, recommendation systems.
**Part B:** Dijkstra (non-negative weights), Bellman-Ford (negative weights), Floyd-Warshall (all pairs). A* for heuristic.
**Part C:** Kruskal's (sort edges, union-find), Prim's (grow from vertex). Applications: network design, clustering.

questions.question: Software project management, Risk management, Estimation techniques
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Planning, scheduling, resource allocation, communication, monitoring, quality assurance.
**Part B:** Identify risks, analyze (probability × impact), mitigation strategies, contingency plans, monitoring.
**Part C:** Expert judgment, Analogous, Parametric, Bottom-up, Three-point (optimistic, most likely, pessimistic).

questions.question: Formal methods in software, Model checking, Software verification tools
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Mathematical specifications, prove correctness, Z notation, VDM, formal proofs.
**Part B:** Exhaustively check all states, temporal logic (LTL, CTL), state explosion problem, abstraction.
**Part C:** Static analyzers (lint), theorem provers (Coq), model checkers (SPIN), symbolic execution

questions.question: Computer networks fundamentals, Network devices comparison, Protocol layers interaction
questions.answer:
**Part A:** LAN, WAN, MAN. Bandwidth, latency, throughput. Circuit vs packet switching.
**Part B:** Hub (broadcast), Switch (MAC learning), Router (IP routing), Gateway (protocol translation), Bridge.
**Part C:** Encapsulation, each layer adds header, data moves down (send) and up (receive). PDU names: segment, packet, frame.

questions.question: Operating system services, System calls categories, Shell and command line
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Process management, memory management, file system, I/O, networking, security.
**Part B:** Process control (fork, exec, exit), File (open, read, write, close), Device (ioctl), Information (getpid), Communication (pipe, shmget).
**Part C:** Shell interprets commands, pipes (|), redirection (>, <), background (&), scripting (bash, PowerShell).

questions.question: Database design process, ER to relational mapping, Query optimization
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Requirements analysis, conceptual design (ER), logical design (relational), physical design (indexes, partitioning).
**Part B:** Entity → Table, Attributes → Columns, 1:1 (merge or FK), 1:N (FK in many side), M:N (junction table).
**Part C:** Query plans, indexes usage, join algorithms (nested loop, hash, merge), EXPLAIN statement, statistics.

questions.question: Information security principles, Access control models, Cryptographic applications
questions.answer:
**Part A:** CIA triad: Confidentiality (secrecy), Integrity (unchanged), Availability (accessible). Also: Authentication, Non-repudiation.
**Part B:** DAC (owner controls), MAC (labels, clearance), RBAC (roles), ABAC (attributes). Principle of least privilege.
**Part C:** Secure communication (TLS), Digital signatures, Password hashing, Disk encryption, PKI/certificates.

questions.question: Distributed systems concepts, Consistency models, Distributed algorithms
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Transparency, scalability, fault tolerance, concurrency. Challenges: network failures, clock sync, consensus.
**Part B:** Strong consistency (linearizability), Sequential, Causal, Eventual. Trade-offs with availability.
**Part C:** Leader election (Bully, Ring), Consensus (Paxos, Raft), Distributed transactions (2PC, 3PC).

questions.question: Web technologies and architecture, RESTful services, Frontend frameworks
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Client-server, HTTP/HTTPS, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, cookies/sessions, caching.
**Part B:** REST: stateless, resources, HTTP verbs (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), JSON, status codes. vs SOAP (XML, complex).
**Part C:** React (components, virtual DOM), Angular (TypeScript, two-way binding), Vue (progressive). SPA vs MPA.

questions.question: Emerging technologies overview, IoT architecture, Blockchain fundamentals
questions.answer:
**Part A:** AI/ML, IoT, Blockchain, Cloud, 5G, Quantum computing, AR/VR, Edge computing.
**Part B:** Perception layer (sensors), Network layer (connectivity), Application layer. Protocols: MQTT, CoAP. Security challenges.
**Part C:** Distributed ledger, blocks + chain + hash, consensus (PoW, PoS), smart contracts, applications beyond cryptocurrency.

questions.question: Modern programming concepts, Concurrent programming, Memory management in languages
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Closures, generators, decorators, async programming, type inference, null safety.
**Part B:** Threads, processes, synchronization (mutex, semaphore), deadlock, race conditions. Async/await, futures/promises.
**Part C:** Manual (C malloc/free), Garbage collection (Java, Python), Reference counting (Swift), RAII (C++).

questions.question: Advanced data structures, Self-balancing trees comparison, Probabilistic data structures
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Trie (string search), Segment tree (range queries), Fenwick tree (prefix sums), Skip list, Union-Find.
**Part B:** AVL (strict balance, faster lookup), Red-Black (relaxed, faster insert/delete), B-tree (disk-based, databases), Splay (self-adjusting).
**Part C:** Bloom filter (membership, false positives), HyperLogLog (cardinality), Count-Min Sketch (frequency). Space-efficient.

questions.question: Software architecture evolution, Microservices patterns, API design principles
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Monolithic → SOA → Microservices → Serverless. Drivers: scalability, deployment, team autonomy.
**Part B:** API Gateway, Service Discovery, Circuit Breaker, Saga pattern, Event sourcing, CQRS.
**Part C:** RESTful conventions, versioning, pagination, error handling, documentation (OpenAPI), rate limiting.

questions.question: Algorithm design techniques, Greedy algorithms analysis, NP-completeness basics
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Brute force, Divide & Conquer, Dynamic Programming, Greedy, Backtracking, Branch & Bound.
**Part B:** Greedy choice property, optimal substructure. Examples: Huffman, Activity Selection, Dijkstra. Not always optimal.
**Part C:** P (polynomial solvable), NP (polynomial verifiable), NP-complete (hardest in NP), NP-hard. Reduction, SAT, Cook's theorem.

questions.question: Network algorithms, Flow networks, String matching algorithms
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Routing (link-state, distance-vector), spanning tree, max flow. Graph coloring for scheduling.
**Part B:** Ford-Fulkerson, Edmonds-Karp, max-flow min-cut theorem. Applications: bipartite matching, network capacity.
**Part C:** Naive O(nm), KMP O(n+m), Rabin-Karp (hashing), Boyer-Moore (right-to-left), Aho-Corasick (multiple patterns).

questions.question: Agile at scale frameworks, Technical debt management, Continuous delivery practices
questions.answer:
**Part A:** SAFe (Scaled Agile), LeSS (Large-Scale Scrum), Spotify model, Nexus. Coordination, alignment, governance.
**Part B:** Identify, measure, prioritize, pay down. Code quality metrics, refactoring sprints, documentation.
**Part C:** CI (frequent integration), CD (automated deployment), feature flags, blue-green deployment, canary releases.

questions.question: Programming language theory, Type systems, Compiler optimization techniques
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Syntax, semantics (operational, denotational, axiomatic), pragmatics. Language design principles.
**Part B:** Static vs Dynamic typing, Strong vs Weak, Type inference, Generics, Algebraic data types.
**Part C:** Dead code elimination, constant folding, loop optimization, inlining, register allocation, instruction scheduling.

questions.question: Network layer protocols in depth, Routing protocols comparison, IPv6 transition mechanisms
questions.answer:
**Part A:** IP (addressing, fragmentation), ICMP (error reporting), ARP (address resolution). IP header fields.
**Part B:** RIP (distance vector, hop count), OSPF (link state, Dijkstra), BGP (path vector, inter-AS). Convergence speed.
**Part C:** Dual-stack, Tunneling (6to4, Teredo), Translation (NAT64). Adoption challenges, benefits of IPv6.

questions.question: Modern OS concepts, Containerization vs virtualization, Kernel architectures
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Microservices support, containers (namespaces, cgroups), immutable infrastructure, orchestration.
**Part B:** VMs: full OS, hypervisor, isolation. Containers: shared kernel, lightweight, fast. Docker, Kubernetes.
**Part C:** Monolithic (Linux), Microkernel (MINIX, QNX), Hybrid (Windows NT, macOS). Trade-offs: performance vs modularity.

questions.question: Advanced database concepts, Transactions in distributed systems, NewSQL databases
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Sharding, replication, partitioning, distributed queries, consensus protocols in databases.
**Part B:** 2PC (blocking), 3PC (non-blocking), Saga pattern (compensating), distributed locks, global transactions.
**Part C:** Combine SQL + scalability: Google Spanner, CockroachDB, TiDB. Distributed transactions, strong consistency.

questions.question: Advanced cybersecurity topics, Penetration testing methodology, Security in SDLC
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Zero-day, APT, supply chain attacks, ransomware, social engineering, insider threats.
**Part B:** Reconnaissance, Scanning, Gaining access, Maintaining access, Covering tracks. Tools: Nmap, Metasploit, Burp.
**Part C:** Secure design, threat modeling, code review, SAST/DAST, security testing, DevSecOps.

questions.question: Cloud computing patterns, Serverless architecture, Multi-cloud strategies
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Auto-scaling, load balancing, CDN, caching patterns, queuing, event-driven.
**Part B:** FaaS (Lambda, Azure Functions), BaaS, cold start, stateless design, use cases (APIs, event processing).
**Part C:** Avoid vendor lock-in, resilience, best-of-breed, challenges (complexity, data transfer, consistency).

questions.question: Software testing automation, Test-driven development, Performance testing
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Unit test frameworks, integration testing, E2E testing (Selenium, Cypress), CI integration, test coverage.
**Part B:** TDD: Red-Green-Refactor cycle. Write test first, minimal code to pass, improve design. Benefits: design, documentation.
**Part C:** Load testing (JMeter), stress testing, benchmarking, profiling, identifying bottlenecks, SLOs.

questions.question: AI ethics and bias, Explainable AI, AI in Pakistan's context
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Bias in training data, fairness, transparency, accountability, privacy (facial recognition), job displacement.
**Part B:** Model interpretability, LIME, SHAP, attention visualization, trade-off with accuracy, regulatory requirements.
**Part C:** Agriculture AI, healthcare, education, e-governance, NLP for Urdu, challenges (data, infrastructure, talent).

questions.question: Functional programming concepts, Reactive programming, Language interoperability
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Pure functions, immutability, higher-order functions, currying, monads, lazy evaluation.
**Part B:** Observable streams, async data flows, RxJS, back-pressure, event-driven systems. Benefits: responsiveness.
**Part C:** FFI (Foreign Function Interface), JNI, interop in .NET, WebAssembly, serialization formats (JSON, Protocol Buffers).

questions.question: Cache-efficient algorithms, External memory algorithms, Parallel algorithms
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Cache-oblivious algorithms, blocking, memory access patterns, cache misses, locality optimization.
**Part B:** B-trees for disk, external merge sort, I/O model, buffer management. Minimize disk accesses.
**Part C:** Parallel prefix, parallel merge sort, MapReduce model, PRAM model, Amdahl's law, work-span analysis.

questions.question: Domain-driven design, Event sourcing, CQRS pattern
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Ubiquitous language, bounded contexts, aggregates, entities, value objects, domain events.
**Part B:** Store events not state, event store, replay for state, audit trail, temporal queries.
**Part C:** Command Query Responsibility Segregation, separate read/write models, eventual consistency, materialized views.

questions.question: Approximation algorithms, Randomized algorithms, Online algorithms
questions.answer:
**Part A:** For NP-hard problems, guaranteed approximation ratio. Examples: Vertex Cover (2-approx), TSP (1.5-approx).
**Part B:** Las Vegas (always correct, expected time), Monte Carlo (may err, bounded time). Examples: QuickSort, Primality.
**Part C:** Make decisions without future knowledge. Competitive ratio. Examples: Paging (LRU), Ski rental problem.

questions.question: Computational geometry basics, Geographic information systems, Spatial indexing
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Convex hull, line intersection, polygon triangulation, Voronoi diagrams, Delaunay triangulation.
**Part B:** GIS concepts, spatial data types, coordinate systems, projections, spatial analysis, applications.
**Part C:** R-tree, Quad-tree, KD-tree, Geohash. Spatial queries: range, nearest neighbor, within polygon.

questions.question: Software evolution and maintenance, Legacy system modernization, Technical debt quantification
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Lehman's laws, software aging, change management, impact analysis, regression testing.
**Part B:** Strangler pattern, incremental rewrite, API wrapping, data migration strategies, risk mitigation.
**Part C:** Code metrics, SQALE model, interest metaphor, debt tracking tools, prioritization, refactoring budget.

questions.question: Formal verification advanced, Abstract interpretation, Symbolic execution
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Hoare logic, pre/postconditions, loop invariants, proof obligations, verified compilers.
**Part B:** Sound approximation, abstract domains, fixpoint computation, static analysis tools.
**Part C:** Execute symbolically, path conditions, SMT solvers, test generation, bug finding tools (KLEE).

questions.question: Software-defined networking, Network function virtualization, Intent-based networking
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Separate control/data planes, centralized controller, OpenFlow protocol, programmability.
**Part B:** Virtualize network functions (firewall, load balancer), reduced hardware, agility, orchestration.
**Part C:** Declare intent (what), system determines (how), AI/ML for automation, self-healing networks.

questions.question: Real-time operating systems, Embedded systems programming, IoT operating systems
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Hard vs soft real-time, WCET analysis, rate monotonic scheduling, priority inversion, watchdog timers.
**Part B:** Memory constraints, bare-metal vs RTOS, interrupts, DMA, low-power design, cross-compilation.
**Part C:** Contiki, Zephyr, FreeRTOS, RIOT. Requirements: small footprint, networking, power management.

questions.question: Graph databases, Time-series databases, Multi-model databases
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Property graphs, Cypher query language, traversals, use cases (social, knowledge graphs). Neo4j, JanusGraph.
**Part B:** Optimized for timestamped data, compression, aggregations, retention policies. InfluxDB, TimescaleDB.
**Part C:** Support multiple models in one DBMS. ArangoDB, CosmosDB. Flexibility, reduced complexity.

questions.question: Zero trust security model, Identity and access management, Security automation
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Never trust, always verify. Micro-segmentation, least privilege, continuous verification, assume breach.
**Part B:** SSO, OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML, MFA, identity federation, privileged access management.
**Part C:** SOAR (Security Orchestration), playbooks, SIEM integration, threat intelligence automation, incident response.

questions.question: Edge computing architecture, Fog computing, 5G and MEC
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Compute at edge, reduce latency, bandwidth savings, offline capability. Edge vs cloud trade-offs.
**Part B:** Between edge and cloud, distributed processing, IoT gateway, hierarchical architecture.
**Part C:** Multi-access Edge Computing, ultra-low latency, network slicing, edge-native applications.

questions.question: Site reliability engineering, Chaos engineering, Observability practices
questions.answer:
**Part A:** SLIs, SLOs, SLAs, error budgets, toil reduction, blameless postmortems, on-call practices.
**Part B:** Intentionally inject failures, Chaos Monkey, game days, resilience testing, failure modes.
**Part C:** Logs, metrics, traces. Distributed tracing (Jaeger), metrics (Prometheus), centralized logging (ELK).

questions.question: Deep learning architectures, Natural language processing advances, Computer vision applications
questions.answer:
**Part A:** CNN (images), RNN/LSTM (sequences), Transformer (attention), GAN (generation), autoencoder.
**Part B:** Word embeddings, Transformers, BERT, GPT, attention mechanism, transfer learning, NLU/NLG.
**Part C:** Object detection (YOLO), image segmentation, face recognition, autonomous driving, medical imaging.

questions.question: C++ pattern function, CS disciplines comparison, Pointer code analysis
Algorithm design for problem solving, Space-time trade-offs, Problem decomposition
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Understand problem, identify patterns, choose appropriate algorithm type, analyze complexity, optimize.
**Part B:** Hash tables (space for time), compression (time for space), caching, precomputation, auxiliary data structures.
**Part C:** Break into subproblems, identify base cases, combine solutions. Top-down vs bottom-up approaches.

questions.question: Software architecture documentation, Architecture decision records, Technical specifications
questions.answer:
**Part A:** C4 model (Context, Containers, Components, Code), viewpoints (logical, process, development, physical).
**Part B:** ADR: context, decision, consequences, status. Capture rationale, alternatives considered, trade-offs.
**Part C:** Functional requirements, non-functional requirements, constraints, interfaces, acceptance criteria.

questions.question: Circle class with constructors, Virtual functions in C++
Recursive power function, Encryption comparison (DES, AES, RSA), isPrime complexity
Test automation frameworks, Behavior-driven development, Contract testing
questions.answer:
**Part A:** JUnit, pytest, Selenium, Cypress, TestNG. Setup/teardown, assertions, test runners, reporting.
**Part B:** BDD: Given-When-Then syntax, Cucumber, Gherkin. Collaboration between business and technical.
**Part C:** Consumer-driven contracts, Pact, API compatibility, prevent integration failures, microservices testing.

questions.question: Code review best practices, Static code analysis, Technical interviews approaches
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Review scope, constructive feedback, focus on important issues, timely reviews, approve/request changes.
**Part B:** SonarQube, ESLint, Checkstyle. Code quality, security vulnerabilities, code smells, technical debt.
**Part C:** Problem solving, coding exercises, system design, behavioral questions, take-home assignments.

questions.question: Application layer protocols deep dive, DNS and CDN, Web sockets and real-time
questions.answer:
**Part A:** HTTP/2 (multiplexing, headers compression), HTTP/3 (QUIC, UDP-based), gRPC (Protocol Buffers, streaming).
**Part B:** DNS hierarchy, recursive/iterative queries, caching, CDN edge servers, content distribution, anycast.
**Part C:** Full-duplex communication, persistent connection, use cases (chat, gaming, live data), Socket.io.

questions.question: Linux internals overview, System administration basics, Shell scripting
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Process model, virtual file system, system calls, kernel modules, memory management, scheduling.
**Part B:** User management, permissions, services (systemd), package management, networking, monitoring.
**Part C:** Bash scripting, variables, loops, conditionals, functions, text processing (awk, sed), automation.

questions.question: Database performance tuning, Query optimization techniques, Database monitoring
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Index tuning, query rewriting, denormalization, connection pooling, caching, hardware optimization.
**Part B:** EXPLAIN ANALYZE, index usage, join order, subquery optimization, statistics updates.
**Part C:** Slow query logs, connection monitoring, lock analysis, resource utilization, alerting thresholds.

questions.question: Web application security, OWASP Top 10, Security headers
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Input validation, output encoding, authentication, session management, HTTPS, CSP.
**Part B:** Injection, Broken Auth, XSS, Insecure Design, Misconfiguration, Vulnerable Components, etc. Mitigations.
**Part C:** CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options. Prevent XSS, clickjacking, MIME sniffing.

questions.question: Container orchestration, Kubernetes architecture, Service mesh
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Scheduling, scaling, self-healing, load balancing, rolling updates, resource management.
**Part B:** Control plane (API server, etcd, scheduler), worker nodes, pods, services, deployments, namespaces.
**Part C:** Istio, Linkerd. Sidecar proxy, traffic management, observability, security (mTLS), canary deployments.

questions.question: Mobile development approaches, Cross-platform frameworks, Mobile app architecture
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Native (Swift/Kotlin), Cross-platform (React Native, Flutter), Hybrid (Ionic, Cordova), PWA.
**Part B:** React Native (JavaScript, native components), Flutter (Dart, custom rendering), Xamarin (.NET).
**Part C:** MVC, MVP, MVVM, Clean Architecture, offline-first, state management, API integration.

questions.question: Data engineering fundamentals, ETL and data pipelines, Data quality management
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Data collection, storage, processing, delivery. Batch vs streaming, data lakes, data warehouses.
**Part B:** Extract (sources), Transform (clean, aggregate), Load (destination). Tools: Airflow, Spark, dbt.
**Part C:** Data profiling, validation rules, anomaly detection, lineage tracking, data governance.

questions.question: Modern JavaScript features, TypeScript benefits, Build tools and bundlers
questions.answer:
**Part A:** ES6+: arrow functions, destructuring, spread, async/await, modules, optional chaining, nullish coalescing.
**Part B:** Static typing, interfaces, better IDE support, catch errors early, maintainability, gradual adoption.
**Part C:** Webpack, Vite, esbuild, Rollup. Module bundling, tree shaking, code splitting, hot module replacement.

questions.question: System design principles, Scalability patterns, Reliability engineering
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Separation of concerns, single responsibility, loose coupling, high cohesion, KISS, YAGNI.
**Part B:** Horizontal scaling, load balancing, caching, sharding, async processing, CDN.
**Part C:** Redundancy, failover, graceful degradation, circuit breakers, health checks, disaster recovery.

questions.question: Code quality metrics, Technical debt identification, Refactoring strategies
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Cyclomatic complexity, code coverage, duplication, coupling, cohesion, maintainability index.
**Part B:** Code smells, outdated dependencies, missing tests, documentation debt, architecture erosion.
**Part C:** Extract method/class, inline, rename, move, replace conditional with polymorphism, introduce parameter object.

questions.question: Algorithm optimization techniques, Amortized analysis, Competitive programming basics
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Memoization, pruning, early termination, bit manipulation, precomputation, data structure choice.
**Part B:** Average cost over sequence of operations. Examples: dynamic array resize, splay tree. Accounting method.
**Part C:** Time management, problem reading, common patterns, practice strategies, online judges (Codeforces, LeetCode).

questions.question: Database design patterns, CQRS implementation, Event-driven databases
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Repository pattern, Unit of Work, Active Record, Data Mapper. When to use each.
**Part B:** Separate read/write models, eventual consistency, projection building, benefits for complex domains.
**Part C:** Event sourcing, CDC (Change Data Capture), event stores, rebuilding state, audit capabilities.

questions.question: Software documentation practices, API documentation, Developer experience
questions.answer:
**Part A:** README, architecture docs, runbooks, ADRs, inline comments, wikis. Keep docs updated.
**Part B:** OpenAPI/Swagger, examples, authentication docs, error documentation, SDKs, interactive docs.
**Part C:** Onboarding, local development setup, debugging tools, clear error messages, documentation quality.

questions.question: Open source contribution, Software licensing, Community management
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Finding projects, reading contribution guidelines, issues/PRs, code review, documentation contributions.
**Part B:** MIT, Apache 2.0, GPL, BSD. Permissive vs copyleft, license compatibility, choosing a license.
**Part C:** Maintainer responsibilities, code of conduct, communication channels, release management, governance.

questions.question: Network automation, Infrastructure as Code, GitOps practices
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Ansible, Terraform, configuration management, network programmability, APIs for network devices.
**Part B:** Declarative infrastructure, version control, reproducibility, drift detection. Terraform, CloudFormation.
**Part C:** Git as single source of truth, automated deployment, pull-based deployment (Flux, ArgoCD).

questions.question: Operating system security, Kernel hardening, Secure boot process
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Access control, sandboxing, ASLR, DEP, kernel security modules (SELinux, AppArmor).
**Part B:** Minimal kernel, disable unused features, syscall filtering, kernel address space isolation, updates.
**Part C:** UEFI secure boot, chain of trust, TPM, measured boot, attestation.

questions.question: Data modeling for analytics, OLAP cubes, Data lakehouse architecture
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Dimensional modeling, star/snowflake schema, fact/dimension tables, slowly changing dimensions.
**Part B:** Multi-dimensional analysis, aggregations, roll-up/drill-down, pivot tables, MDX queries.
**Part C:** Combine data lake + warehouse benefits. Delta Lake, Iceberg. ACID on data lakes, schema evolution.

questions.question: Privacy engineering, GDPR compliance, Privacy by design
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Data minimization, anonymization, pseudonymization, differential privacy, secure computation.
**Part B:** Lawful basis, consent, data subject rights, DPO, privacy impact assessments, breach notification.
**Part C:** Proactive, privacy as default, embedded in design, full lifecycle protection, visibility, respect for users.

questions.question: Event-driven architecture patterns, Message queues comparison, Exactly-once delivery
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Event sourcing, CQRS, pub/sub, event mesh, choreography vs orchestration.
**Part B:** RabbitMQ (AMQP), Kafka (distributed log), SQS (managed). Throughput, ordering, durability.
**Part C:** Idempotency, deduplication, transactional outbox, at-least-once + idempotent consumers.

questions.question: Production debugging techniques, Distributed tracing, Incident management
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Logs analysis, metrics correlation, profiling, heap dumps, remote debugging, feature flags.
**Part B:** Trace context propagation, spans, Jaeger, Zipkin, OpenTelemetry. Request flow visualization.
**Part C:** Detection, triage, mitigation, resolution, postmortem. On-call rotations, runbooks, communication.

questions.question: MLOps fundamentals, Model deployment strategies, ML system monitoring
questions.answer:
**Part A:** ML lifecycle management, experiment tracking, model registry, feature stores, CI/CD for ML.
**Part B:** Batch inference, real-time serving, edge deployment, A/B testing, canary releases, shadow mode.
**Part C:** Data drift, concept drift, model performance degradation, feature monitoring, retraining triggers.

questions.question: Future of IT in Pakistan, Virus vs Trojan vs Worm, LaTeX advantages/disadvantages
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Opportunities: Freelancing (4th globally), IT exports ($2.5B+), youth demographics, government initiatives. Challenges: Infrastructure, education gap, brain drain.
**Part B:** Virus: self-replicates, needs host. Trojan: disguised, no self-replication. Worm: self-replicates, no host needed.
**Part C:** LaTeX advantages: professional math formulas, auto-numbering, academic standard. Disadvantages: steep learning curve, not WYSIWYG.

questions.question: AI and automation impact, Quantum computing basics, Emerging programming paradigms
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Job transformation, new roles, upskilling needs, productivity gains, ethical considerations.
**Part B:** Qubits, superposition, entanglement, quantum gates, algorithms (Shor, Grover), NISQ era, applications.
**Part C:** Low-code/no-code, AI-assisted coding, domain-specific languages, visual programming, natural language programming.

questions.question: Software sustainability, Green computing practices, Technical sustainability
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Environmental impact of software, energy-efficient code, carbon-aware computing, e-waste.
**Part B:** Energy-efficient algorithms, server optimization, green data centers, power management.
**Part C:** Long-term maintainability, avoid vendor lock-in, open standards, documentation, knowledge transfer.

questions.question: Modern algorithm challenges, Streaming algorithms, Sublinear algorithms
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Big data algorithms, distributed computing, approximation for NP-hard, online learning algorithms.
**Part B:** Single pass, limited memory, approximate answers. Count-Min Sketch, HyperLogLog, reservoir sampling.
**Part C:** Less than linear time/space. Sublinear approximation, property testing, compressed sensing.

questions.question: Platform engineering, Developer platforms, Internal tooling
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Platform as a product, golden paths, self-service, reducing cognitive load for developers.
**Part B:** Internal developer portals, service catalogs, scaffolding tools, Backstage, documentation platforms.
**Part C:** Build vs buy decisions, maintenance burden, developer productivity measurement, adoption strategies.

questions.question: AI in software development, Code generation tools, AI pair programming
questions.answer:
**Part A:** GitHub Copilot, code completion, test generation, documentation generation, code review assistance.
**Part B:** LLM-based code generation, prompt engineering, limitations, security concerns, intellectual property.
**Part C:** Human-AI collaboration, reviewing AI suggestions, maintaining code understanding, skill development.

questions.question: Software architecture for AI systems, ML infrastructure, Data-centric AI
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Training pipelines, serving infrastructure, experiment management, monitoring, scalability.
**Part B:** GPU clusters, distributed training, feature stores, model registries, inference optimization.
**Part C:** Data quality over model complexity, data augmentation, active learning, data versioning.

questions.question: 5G and beyond networks, Network slicing, Private networks
questions.answer:
**Part A:** 5G: eMBB, URLLC, mMTC. Beyond: 6G research, terahertz, AI-native networks.
**Part B:** Virtual dedicated networks on shared infrastructure. Use cases, isolation, SLA management.
**Part C:** Enterprise 5G, CBRS, on-premise connectivity, industrial IoT, security benefits.

questions.question: eBPF and modern observability, Kernel bypass technologies, Performance optimization
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Extended BPF, programmable kernel, observability without instrumentation, security applications.
**Part B:** DPDK, XDP, user-space networking, high-performance applications.
**Part C:** Profiling, tracing, bottleneck identification, system tuning, benchmarking methodology.

questions.question: Vector databases, Embeddings and semantic search, RAG architecture
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Store and query vector embeddings. Pinecone, Milvus, Weaviate. Similarity search, ANN algorithms.
**Part B:** Text/image embeddings, semantic similarity, recommendation systems, anomaly detection.
**Part C:** Retrieval-Augmented Generation: retrieve relevant context, augment LLM prompts, reduce hallucinations.

questions.question: Supply chain security, SBOM and dependency management, Secure software supply chain
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Third-party risks, compromised dependencies, build system attacks, SolarWinds lessons.
**Part B:** Software Bill of Materials, dependency scanning, license compliance, vulnerability tracking.
**Part C:** Signed artifacts, reproducible builds, SLSA framework, trusted build systems.

questions.question: FinOps practices, Cloud cost optimization, Resource right-sizing
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Financial accountability for cloud, cost visibility, optimization, collaboration between teams.
**Part B:** Reserved instances, spot instances, auto-scaling, unused resource cleanup, architecture optimization.
**Part C:** Resource utilization analysis, recommendations, automation, balancing cost and performance.

questions.question: Reliability patterns, Chaos engineering advanced, Resilience testing
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Circuit breaker, bulkhead, retry with backoff, timeout, fallback, rate limiting.
**Part B:** Hypothesis-driven experiments, blast radius control, game days, steady state definition.
**Part C:** Failure injection, load testing, dependency failure simulation, disaster recovery drills.

questions.question: Generative AI applications, LLM fine-tuning, Responsible AI deployment
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Content generation, code synthesis, design, customer service, creative applications.
**Part B:** Domain adaptation, RLHF, LoRA, prompt tuning, instruction tuning, evaluation.
**Part C:** Bias mitigation, content filtering, transparency, monitoring, human oversight, ethical guidelines.

questions.question: Overloading vs Overriding, Preventing inheritance, Bubble vs Selection sort
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Overloading: same name, different parameters (compile-time). Overriding: redefine parent method (runtime polymorphism).
**Part B:** C++: `class Final final {}`. Java: `final class`. Alternative: private constructor with factory.
**Part C:** Both O(n²). Bubble: O(n²) swaps, stable. Selection: O(n) swaps, unstable. Selection fewer swaps.

questions.question: Marks to grades program, BFS implementation, Regular expressions for formats
AI agents and autonomous systems, Multi-agent systems, Human-AI collaboration
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Autonomous agents, goal-directed behavior, planning, tool use, memory, reasoning chains.
**Part B:** Agent coordination, communication protocols, emergent behavior, swarm intelligence.
**Part C:** Human-in-the-loop, oversight mechanisms, trust calibration, complementary strengths.

questions.question: Data structures for modern computing, Concurrent data structures, Persistent data structures
questions.answer:
**Part A:** Cache-efficient structures, SIMD-friendly layouts, memory-mapped structures, compressed representations.
**Part B:** Lock-free, wait-free structures, CAS operations, concurrent hash maps, concurrent queues.
**Part C:** Immutable with efficient updates, structural sharing, Clojure vectors, functional programming support.

questions.question: Software architecture for scale, Global distributed systems, Multi-region deployments

**Part B:** Data replication, conflict resolution, latency considerations, global load balancing.

questions.question: Future of software development, No-code/low-code platforms, AI-augmented development

**Part B:** Prove knowledge without revealing it. zk-SNARKs, zk-STARKs, applications in blockchain, authentication.
**Part C:** Homomorphic encryption, secure multi-party computation, federated learning, differential privacy.

questions.question: Sustainable computing, Green software engineering, Carbon-aware computing

**Part B:** Efficient algorithms, resource optimization, cloud sustainability, measuring carbon footprint.

questions.question: Real-time data processing, Stream processing patterns, Complex event processing
